column4: I'm having  some problems. I have a Dell Xps M1730 and I can't get the wifi to work. "rfkill List" says that the device is hardware disabled. Is there anything I can do about this?
lshw -C network
pastebin output
ok It will be a bit because I have to reboot to that os
Sorry it took so long http://pastebin.com/zghMTBYS
try holding the kill switch on for a while, don't release immediately, i have an intel card and for some reason i need to do this with recent kernels
my switch is a slider on switch
yes, press it and keep it until the indicators lights up
the wifi light does flash, The bluetooth is also controlled by this swith and it stays on, if that makes a difference
so the indicator is on but no difference?
Bluetooth: yes Wifi: no
one light for both of them?
no, two seperate lights but one switch for both
tail -f /var/log/messages while you flip the switch
ok, I have to reboot again
back, http://pastebin.com/gYXnVS7g

try .. Â sudo echo 0 > /sys/class/net/wlan0/device/rf_kill ... sudo ifconfig wlan0 up ... iwlist wlan0 scan... this should show you available networks.. if not, it could be a hardware issue https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/230844
Alright, I'll give it a try
sudo su -, and type the commands without sudo
I had a few typos but here it is, http://pastebin.com/aeFKHHbs
The wifi light did light up but I couldn't find any networks
